content:
A THON attendee records the dancing relations captains performing a line dance during THON at the Bryce Jordan Center on Sunday Feb PERIOD   PERIOD

Penn State is asking those who plan to attend THON this weekend to make sure they arent carrying any germs into the Bryce Jordan Center PERIOD

University Health Services UHS urged individuals who may be sick not to attend THON this weekend according to a press release PERIOD UHS highly recommends that any individual who displays symptoms of the flu stay out of the Bryce Jordan Center PERIOD

The release said the flu may infect children and individuals with weaker immune systems at THON PERIOD

Symptoms of the flu include feeling feverish having chills coughing vomiting or having a sore throat stuffy nose body aches headaches fatigue or diarrhea PERIOD

The release encouraged individuals to take precautions against the flu by avoiding sick people covering coughs and sneezes with a tissue or sleeve washing hands frequently and not sharing food and drink with others PERIOD

Penn State Student Affairs and UHS also recommended THON attendees get a flu shot prior to the weekend to protect themselves from infectious illnesses PERIOD
